  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales Associate",
  "description": "Sefa Minimart Provision Store is a vibrant, community-focused retail destination dedicated to providing a wide range of everyday essentials and provisions to meet the needs of our valued customers. Conveniently located, our store offers a carefully curated selection of high-quality merchandise, including groceries, household goods, personal care products, and other daily necessities, all at competitive prices.
At Sefa Minimart, we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional customer service, fostering a welcoming environment where shoppers feel valued and supported. Our commitment to convenience, affordability, and quality ensures that customers can find everything they need in one place, making their shopping experience seamless and enjoyable. Whether it&rsquo;s quick snacks, household staples, or specialty items, Sefa Minimart is your trusted one-stop shop.
Our dedicated team works diligently to maintain a clean, organized, and well-stocked store, ensuring that every visit is met with efficiency and care. Sefa Minimart Provision Store is more than just a store&mdash;it&rsquo;s a cornerstone of the community, built on reliability, trust, and a passion for serving our customers&rsquo;everydayneeds.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Associate

Job Location:&nbsp;Galadimawa, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Sefa Minimart Provision Store is seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic Sales Associate to join our team.
	As a cornerstone of our community-focused retail environment, the Sales Associate will play a key role in delivering exceptional customer service, maintaining store operations, and contributing to the overall success of our business.


Key Responsibilities


	Customer Service: Greet and assist customers in a friendly, courteous, and professional manner, addressing their inquiries, recommending products, and ensuring a positive shopping experience.
	Sales and Transactions: Operate the cash register, process payments accurately, and handle returns or exchanges in accordance with store policies.
	Inventory Management: Assist with restocking shelves, organizing displays, and monitoring inventory levels to ensure products are readily available for customers.
	Store Maintenance: Maintain a clean, organized, and welcoming store environment by performing tasks such as sweeping, dusting, and arranging merchandise.
	Product Knowledge: Develop and maintain knowledge of the store&rsquo;s product offerings, including groceries, household goods, and personal care items, to effectively assist customers.
	Compliance with Policies: Adhere to all company policies, including those related to punctuality, safety, and customer interactions, to uphold the store&rsquo;s standards and reputation.


Requirements


	Education: High school diploma or equivalent preferred, but not mandatory.
	Experience: No prior retail experience required; however, experience in customer service, retail, or a similar role is a plus. On-the-job training will be provided to ensure success in the role.
	Availability: Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays, as determined by the store&rsquo;s scheduling needs.
	Interested candidates must reside in Galadimawa Community in Abuja.


Required Skills:


	Customer Service Excellence: Strong interpersonal and communication skills to engage with customers in a friendly, respectful, and professional manner, ensuring a positive shopping experience.
	Reliability and Punctuality: A proven track record of punctuality and dependability, with the ability to adhere to assigned work schedules and notify management promptly in case of unavoidable absences.
	Basic Math Proficiency: Competence in handling cash transactions, processing payments, and providing accurate change to customers.
	Organizational Skills: Ability to maintain a clean, orderly, and well-stocked store environment, including restocking shelves and arranging merchandise displays.
	Teamwork: A collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively with colleagues and management to support store operations and achieve business goals.


Preferred Attributes:


	Familiarity with retail point-of-sale systems or inventory management processes is advantageous but not required.
	A proactive attitude and eagerness to learn about the store&rsquo;s product offerings to better assist customers.


Benefits


	A competitive salary of&nbsp;N20,000 - N25,000 monthly dependence on experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to:&nbsp;sefabusinessworld@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	That priority will be given to applicants who reside in Galadimawa, FCT Abuja, as the store is situated there.
	Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, and qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview.
	WhatsApp Number: +2349068956443.

Sales Associate Job at Sefa Minimart Provision Store




        
    

        
        
     

            
    

Sefa Minimart Provision Store is a vibrant, community-focused retail destination dedicated to providing a wide range of everyday essentials and provisions to meet the needs of our valued customers. Conveniently located, our store offers a carefully curated selection of high-quality merchandise, including groceries, household goods, personal care products, and other daily necessities, all at competitive prices.
At Sefa Minimart, we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional customer service, fostering a welcoming environment where shoppers feel valued and supported. Our commitment to convenience, affordability, and quality ensures that customers can find everything they need in one place, making their shopping experience seamless and enjoyable. Whether it’s quick snacks, household staples, or specialty items, Sefa Minimart is your trusted one-stop shop.
Our dedicated team works diligently to maintain a clean, organized, and well-stocked store, ensuring that every visit is met with efficiency and care. Sefa Minimart Provision Store is more than just a store—it’s a cornerstone of the community, built on reliability, trust, and a passion for serving our customers’everydayneeds.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Associate

Job Location: Galadimawa, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Sefa Minimart Provision Store is seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic Sales Associate to join our team.
	As a cornerstone of our community-focused retail environment, the Sales Associate will play a key role in delivering exceptional customer service, maintaining store operations, and contributing to the overall success of our business.


Key Responsibilities


	Customer Service: Greet and assist customers in a friendly, courteous, and professional manner, addressing their inquiries, recommending products, and ensuring a positive shopping experience.
	Sales and Transactions: Operate the cash register, process payments accurately, and handle returns or exchanges in accordance with store policies.
	Inventory Management: Assist with restocking shelves, organizing displays, and monitoring inventory levels to ensure products are readily available for customers.
	Store Maintenance: Maintain a clean, organized, and welcoming store environment by performing tasks such as sweeping, dusting, and arranging merchandise.
	Product Knowledge: Develop and maintain knowledge of the store’s product offerings, including groceries, household goods, and personal care items, to effectively assist customers.
	Compliance with Policies: Adhere to all company policies, including those related to punctuality, safety, and customer interactions, to uphold the store’s standards and reputation.


Requirements


	Education: High school diploma or equivalent preferred, but not mandatory.
	Experience: No prior retail experience required; however, experience in customer service, retail, or a similar role is a plus. On-the-job training will be provided to ensure success in the role.
	Availability: Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays, as determined by the store’s scheduling needs.
	Interested candidates must reside in Galadimawa Community in Abuja.


Required Skills:


	Customer Service Excellence: Strong interpersonal and communication skills to engage with customers in a friendly, respectful, and professional manner, ensuring a positive shopping experience.
	Reliability and Punctuality: A proven track record of punctuality and dependability, with the ability to adhere to assigned work schedules and notify management promptly in case of unavoidable absences.
	Basic Math Proficiency: Competence in handling cash transactions, processing payments, and providing accurate change to customers.
	Organizational Skills: Ability to maintain a clean, orderly, and well-stocked store environment, including restocking shelves and arranging merchandise displays.
	Teamwork: A collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively with colleagues and management to support store operations and achieve business goals.


Preferred Attributes:


	Familiarity with retail point-of-sale systems or inventory management processes is advantageous but not required.
	A proactive attitude and eagerness to learn about the store’s product offerings to better assist customers.


Benefits


	A competitive salary of N20,000 - N25,000 monthly dependence on experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: sefabusinessworld@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	That priority will be given to applicants who reside in Galadimawa, FCT Abuja, as the store is situated there.
	Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, and qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Head of Marketing Job at Termii




        
    

        
        Termii is a communications platform that allows African businesses to send messages to anyone across SMS, email, voice, and instant messaging channels. With Termii businesses can verify customer identity & transactions, send product notifications to customers and generate personality and engagement insights from customer transactions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Marketing

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking an experienced Head of Marketing to lead Termii’s global marketing strategy, elevate our brand presence, and drive measurable business growth.
	This role will be pivotal in positioning Termii as a market leader, generating high-quality leads, and supporting our expansion into new markets.
	The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker, data-driven decision-maker, and a hands-on leader who thrives at the intersection of brand storytelling and revenue generation.


Key Responsibilities
Brand Leadership:


	Develop and execute a bold, differentiated brand strategy that positions Termii as the top CPaaS partner in Africa and beyond.
	Oversee all external communications, PR, and thought leadership initiatives to boost visibility in target markets.


Growth & Demand Generation:


	Partner closely with the Sales team to define and deliver on success metrics for lead generation and pipeline growth.
	Design and implement multi-channel marketing campaigns (digital, events, partnerships) that attract and convert high-value prospects.


Market Expansion:


	Conduct market research to identify high-potential regions and industries, and craft tailored go-to-market strategies.
	Localize marketing approaches for new markets while maintaining Termii’s global brand voice.


Team & Budget Management:


	Build and mentor a high-performing marketing team, fostering a culture of creativity, accountability, and results.
	Manage the marketing budget effectively to maximize ROI across campaigns and initiatives.


Data & Insights:


	Establish performance dashboards to track, analyze, and optimize marketing effectiveness.
	Use market intelligence to inform product positioning and sales enablement.


Requirements


	8+ years of progressive experience in marketing leadership, preferably in SaaS, CPaaS, or technology sectors.
	Proven track record of building brands and delivering measurable lead generation outcomes.
	Strong experience in supporting B2B sales teams and aligning marketing to revenue goals.
	Exceptional storytelling, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
	Experience in new market entry and global expansion strategies is a plus.
	Data-driven, creative, and comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@termii.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Executive Assistant Job at Volition Capital




        
    

        
        Volition Capital was set up to help the honest and hardworking to create wealth. We fulfill our mandate through investment education, cooperatives and partnerships with credible local and international investment companies. Our target audience is working professionals and retirees.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant
Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Mode of Engagement: Full-time with a probation period of 6 months.
Reporting Line: Chief Executive Officer

Roles & Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Strategic Support: Act as a key resource to the CEO, helping to execute strategic priorities and to drive high-level projects.
	Schedule & Calendar Management: Manage the CEO’s schedule, ensuring optimal time allocation across meetings, engagements, and priorities.
	Communication Management: Draft, review, and filter correspondences, concept documents and briefs, ensuring effective communication across internal and external stakeholders.
	Stakeholder Engagement: Act as a liaison between the CEO and internal/external contacts, managing relationships with discretion and professionalism.
	Project Management: Oversee and track key initiatives, ensuring they are progressing in line with business objectives.
	Meeting Coordination: Prepare for meetings, including creating agenda, taking notes, and ensuring follow-up actions are documented and executed.
	Event & Travel Coordination: Plan and organize travel, accommodation, and itineraries to facilitate seamless logistics for the CEO.
	Personal Assistance: Recruit and manage the CEO’s personal assistant and other personal staff to ensure all domestic matters are taken care of.


Qualifications & Experience


	A university degree or equivalent certification.
	10+ years of experience in a related role.
	Proven track record of working with CEOs or Executives.
	Experience working in high-pressure, fast-paced environments.
	Global exposure.


Skill Sets, and Values:


	A strong commitment to service and mission alignment.
	High level of adaptability. Can interact with executives and everyday people seamlessly.
	Exceptional organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Strong writing and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and prioritize effectively.
	Strong discretion and confidentiality in handling all matters.
	Tech-savvy, with proficiency in productivity, documentation, scheduling and AI-assistance tools.
	Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.


Remuneration and Perks


	Competitive remuneration in line with industry benchmarks
	Health insurance
	Communication allowance
	Birthday allowance
	Work-from-home options
	Staff-only investment opportunities
	High degree of autonomy & flexibility
	Global growth opportunities
